alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 6:50PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, northeastern Colfax. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 650 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raton, Sugarite, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Raton Crews Airport. - This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 333 and 339...and between Mile Markers 350 and 374. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 435 and 441. Rural areas of northeastern Colfax county. This includes the following recreation areas... Sugarite Canyon State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
